column5: A couple days ago I emailed a few local taxidermists to see if I could have any scrap fur, at about 10pm I got an email from one of them back, he said that he had bits and pieces of deer and bear. He said he was also a fireman and so he's leave them at the station for me to pick up. So I swung by today expecting a ziplock of small skin patches, it ended up to be way more than I could ever hope for, I got 2 backs, a belly, and a nice sized patch of bear!    Always pays to ask!
Well done. Those remains are probly due to not getting a cape mount..
Need any more caddis there bri? LOL
Hey Chris, wanna tie some flies for me? As for which flies, I dunno... nymphs and maybe streamers? Smaller ones? Prices?
For sure mike, ill text you.

hmm...I wonder if I email a taxidermist up in NWT if I'd score any polar bear or arctic fox?..ha  that's a lot of material right there, I'm guessing we're going to see a follow up thread with a bunch of spun deer hair for bass opener, mice, frogs, dahlbergs and such?
We'll see  most of it is shorter, but I'll at least make a bunch of mice
I'll take a dozen olive bow river buggers
Sounds good brad, shoot me a pm
damn, nice score! thats a lot of deers hair nymphs lol
Scores! Mix that with some turkey tail and you'll have all sorts of creations  S.
Wow, good job.  Never even thought of asking a taxidermist.  Good for you!
When autumn comes shoot me a PM, if your interested I can provide you with all the pheasant feathers you'll ever need. Free for the taking as I normally just chuck em out.
